hackathon-eligibility:
Teams can consist of anywhere between 1-4 people. 
 Also (optionally), you should tweet about what you're budilding during the hackathon using
hackathon-requirements: Submissions to be considered for prizes must include the following:
hackathon-rules:
1. All applications must be built using Meteor. 
2. All apps must be completed within a 24 hour time period during the weekend of October 10th and 11th. 
3. Teams can consist of 1-4 people. 
4. You may code before the hackathon begins only if you make that code usefully available as a package for all to use before the hackathon weekend begins. (No shenanigans here, e.g. don't make a package that is deliberately designed to only be useful for your app)
5. Participants own the code, but we reserve the right to use a likeness of the app in promotional materials.
6. Submissions to be considered for prizes must include the following:
7. Apps will be judged shortly after the weekend of October 10th-11th by a team of judges. 
8. Prizes will be awarded in the following categories: 
     -Top Five Overall Submissions (Judge's Choice) 
     -Top Three Overall Submissions (People's Choice)
     -Best Meteor and IoT Submission
     -Best Game
     -Most Creative Collaborative App 
     -Best App written with less than 100 lines of Javascript(max 80 characters/line)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Galaxy is Meteor's commercial service for operating and managing meteor applications on the cloud. You can learn more here:
The teams that finished 2nd and 3rd in both our judged competition and the public vote will win a one month trial to Galaxy, Meteor's commercial service for running applications in the could.
Have you ever wanted to have a hyper-realistic action figure of yourself? Who are we kidding, of course you have!
Some swag that will let everybody know you were a winner in the 2015 Meteor Global Hackathon.
